message:
Correctness_Score: 0.7
Style_Score: 0.5
Simplicity_Score: 0.5
Robustness_Score: 0.4
Reasoning: The core algorithm (building chains x, x^2, x^4... and checking frequencies) is fundamentally sound and will pass many cases, but there is a clear bug in the special handling for 1s (it computes an impossible odd length when freq[1] is even), so several edge tests will fail. Style is mediocre: there is a useful docstring and some comments, but the file is cluttered with many unused imports and noisy code. The implementation is straightforward but verbose and contains redundant guards (unnecessary overflow checks), so simplicity is only fair; robustness is weakened by the incorrect 1 handling and ad-hoc checks that reduce maintainability.
